intro: Berkheya rhapontica subsp. rhapontica, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and bright yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Berkheya rhapontica subsp. rhapontica is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun.
